result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Norman Hautamaki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $2,300.00 fine plus costs for a total of $3,924.00.

Attend Victim Impact Panel program in Monroe County or similar program in another county and pay program fees.

Complete Driving With Care program or similar program; complete 10-14 education classes beginning within 30 days of sentencing except if not able to attend because of incarceration.

Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No consumption or possession of alcohol; no entering bars, taverns or liquor stores for any purposes except as approved by agent.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Random urinalysis testing.

Comply with any conditions per agent.

Review hearings scheduled for May 2, 2017 @ 10:00 a.m. and August 1, 2017 @ 10:00 a.m.  Defendant to get letter from probation agent and provide it to the Court at least one week prior to the review hearing.  If letter is positive, defendant may contact the Court to see if he needs to appear at the review hearing.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
180 days conditional jail imposed - With Huber privileges - 1st 48 hours without Huber.
May serve in Douglas County.
75% may be served on EMP through Douglas County.

Additional 45 days conditional jail imposed & stayed - may be imposed by the Court at the review hearings if Defendant is not in compliance.
